thread.title: Sam Ehlinger tosses 6 TD passes in 55-3 win over Hays
thread.title_full: Sam Ehlinger tosses 6 TD passes in 55-3 win over Hays | www.statesman.com

author: Michael Adams
title: Sam Ehlinger tosses 6 TD passes in 55-3 win over Hays
text:
Sam Ehlinger connected with Chase Cokley for three of his six touchdown passes to lift Class 6A, No. 8 Westlake (7-0, 5-0 District 14-6A) to a 55-3 win over Hays Friday night.
The UT pledge completed an outstanding night matching his career-high for touchdown passes he set last year against Temple. Ehlinger completed 21 of 25 pass attempts for 369 yards and had 55 yards on 10 carries on the ground with 7 total touchdowns.
The Chaparrals have struggled getting started in the first quarter most of the season, but show no signs of a sluggish start at Bob Shelton Stadium.
Paul Brick Kylen Granson scores a touchdown on a reception during Westlake’s win over the Rebels at Bob Shelton Stadium in Buda on Oct. 16,2015. Ehlinger found Cokley for a 26-yard score on the Chaps’ first possession. He then had a 33-yard touchdown pass to Kylen Granson and a 14-yard toss to Reed Klubnick as the Chaps built a 20-0 lead at the end of the first quarter.
Hays’ punter Travis Selby converted his first of two fake punts late in the first quarter as part of a long drive that carried over into the second quarter. The Rebels (4-4, 3-3) capitalized and got the ball down to the Westlake 14-yard-line. Facing fourth and 1, a false start penalty on the Rebels forced Hays to settle for a 36-yard field goal by Jax Kell.
That would be the only points the Rebels would get as the Chaps built a 34-3lead at halftime.
Westlake opened the second half with pretty much the same momentum, but the Chaps had a 59-yard touchdown reception by Cokley called back due to a holding penalty. Eight plays later, however, Ehlinger found Andrew Boykin for one of two touchdown tosses to the junior.
Westlake had two penalties negate touchdowns. In the first quarter, Elias Garcia had a pick-6 called back for a roughing the passer penalty.
After a 68-yard score by Boykin from Ehlinger on Westlake’s next drive, Mack Kelley returned an interception 30 yards for a touchdown three plays later with 1:51 left in the third quarter.
Westlake 55, Hays 3
Westlake (7-0, 5-0) 20 14 21 0 - 55
Hays (4-4, 3-3) 0 3 0 0 - 3
